{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3342755,"name":"","username":"AshenArtemis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T15:30:38.207Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone!

At our last tournament, we were having some issues with our LL3 and the FMS. The Camera publisher object (all set up by Limelight 3, nothing in the code) was working on the dashboard w/t a bounding box around the Limelight. However, our auto alignment system did not work as well as boolean indicators that specific tags were detected.

Before flashing the radio, all code and streams were working.

While in the pit, the camera steam wasn’t working in Elastic, however the boolean detecting system registered a tag we held up.

I was talking to the AWESOME CSA @Dylan_Watson and he recommended I make a CD post here.

Thanks for your help

Do you have a static IP set on the Limelight, or is it set to DHCP?

Perhaps you could share a picture or description of the networking layout, including what devices you are using and what is connected to what. That may help us to spot if there is an issue

We currently only use one limelight,

We set it up to match the docs:

  • IP: “10.TE.AM.11”
  • Subnet mask: 255.255.255.0
  • Gateway: “10.TE.AM.1”

I didn’t touch the rio and the laptop.

Sure!

Currently we have an ethernet switch as our radio 2nd port doesn’t work. We have our radio + the LL3 plugged into the switch.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T16:45:54.968Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":27.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460020,"topic_slug":"limelight-3-issues-while-connected-to-fms","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":20008,"username":"SndMndBdy","name":"SndMndBdy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/13edae/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64117,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-3-issues-while-connected-to-fms/460020/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342943,"name":"SndMndBdy","username":"SndMndBdy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T17:43:19.422Z","cooked":"

This setup should generally work. One thing to be aware of is that you need to connect the laptop to the switch via a network cable in order to see the Limelight from the laptop. Connecting via a USB cable to the roboRio won’t work.

Yep! What we ended up doing is activating port forwarding and then using the link:
http://roborio-TEAM-frc.local:5801/
to access it.
